tuv.seg: This glossary contains some of the main terms used in connection with problem debt and personal insolvency
Míníonn an ghluais seo na príomhthéarmai a úsáidtear i leith cúrsaí fiachais
The following organisations also publish collections of terms related to debt:
Foilsíonn na h-eagraíochtaí seo leanas liostaí téarmaíochta freisin:
• Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) - glossary
• Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann
• Money Advice and Budgeting Service (MABS) – jargon buster
• Seirbhís Bhuiséadta agus Chomhairle Airgid
• Competition and Consumer Protection Commission - jargon buster
• Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí
This is a person or class of persons authorised by the Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) to support a debtor to make an application for a Debt Relief Notice (DRN)
Is éard is idirghabhálaí faofa na duine nó aicme daoine atá údaraithe ag Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (ISI) chun tacú le féichiúnaí iarratas ar Fhógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais (DRN) a dhéanamh
Bankruptcy is a settlement of the debts of someone who is wholly or partially unable to repay their debts
Is éard is féimheacht ann ná glanadh fiachas duine atá go hiomlán nó go páirteach neamhábalta a c(h)uid fiachas a aisíoc
It deals with both secured and unsecured debt
Déileálann sí le fiachas urraithe agus neamhurraithe araon
The purpose of the bankruptcy is to distribute your assets fairly among your creditors and protect you from these creditors
Is éard is cuspóir na féimheachta ná chun do shócmhainní a dháileadh go cóir i measc do chreidiúnaithe agus tú a chosaint ó na creidiúnaithe sin
The distribution is done through a court official, the Official Assignee in Bankruptcy
Déantar an dáileadh trí oifigeach cúirte, an Sannaí Oifigiúil i bhFéimheacht
Read more in our document on bankruptcy
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis maidir le féimheacht
Code of Conduct on Mortgage Arrears (CCMA)
Cód Iompair maidir le Riaráistí Morgáiste (CCMA)
The CCMA is a statutory code, issued by the Central Bank of Ireland, which requires mortgage lenders to adopt specific procedures when dealing with borrowers who are facing mortgage arrears

Is cód iompair reachtúil é an CCMA, arna eisiúint ag Banc Ceannais na hÉireann, a cheanglaíonn ar iasachtóirí morgáiste glacadh le nósanna imeachta sonracha nuair a bhíonn siad ag déileáil le hiasachtaithe atá thíos riaráistí morgáiste
Under this Code, each lender must have a Mortgage Arrears Resolution Process (MARP)
Faoin gCód seo, ní mór go mbeadh Próiseas Réitigh do Riaráistí Morgáiste (MARP)
Read more in our document on Consumer protection codes and mortgages
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis faoi cóid um chosaint tomhaltóirí agus morgáistí
The rules on consumer credit agreements apply to almost all credit agreements, hire-purchase agreements and consumer-hire agreements to which a consumer is a party
Baineann na rialacha le beagnach gach comhaontú creidmheasa, comhaontuithe fruilcheannaigh agus comhaontuithe fruilithe ag tomhaltóir a bhfuil tomhaltóir ar pháirtí
So, they apply to agreements to borrow money which you make with banks, building societies, moneylenders and certain other finance companies
Mar sin, baineann siad le comhaontuithe chun iasacht airgid a dhéanann tú le bainc, cumainn fhoirgníochta, iasachtóirí airgid agus comhlachtaí airgeadais áirithe eile
They do not apply to agreements to borrow money from credit unions, pawnbrokers and utility service providers nor do they apply to agreements entered into by businesses
Ní bhaineann siad le comhaontuithe airgead a fháil ar iasacht ó na comhair chreidmheasa, geallbhróicéirí nó ó sholáthraithe seirbhísí fóntais, ná le comhaontuithe arna ndéanamh ag gnóthaí
Agreements covered by the consumer credit legislation must be in writing
Más rud é nach bhfuil siad i scríbhinn, níl siad in-fheidhmithe
If they are not in writing, they are not enforceable
Ciallaíonn sé sin nach n-éireodh leis an gcreidiúnaí in aon ghníomh breithiúnais i do choinne i leith na bhfiacha
The legislation provides that it is an offence for a creditor to demand payment if the agreement is not enforceable
Forálann an reachtaíocht gur cion é do chreidiúnaí íocaíocht a éileamh mura bhfuil an comhaontú in-fheidhmithe
The Central Bank’s Consumer Protection Code applies to most consumer credit agreements
Baineann Cód Cosanta an Rialtóra Airgeadais do Thomhaltóirí leis an gcuid is mó de chomhaontuithe creidmheasa tomhaltóra
The Consumer Protection Code for Licensed Moneylenders applies to moneylenders
Baineann an Cód um Chosaint Tomhaltóirí d’ Iasachtóirí Airgid Ceadúnaithe le hiasachtóirí airgid
In a debt context, a contract is an agreement by one party to provide goods or services for another in return for payment
I gcomhthéacs fiachais, is éard is conradh ann ná comhaontú le páirtí amháin earraí nó seirbhísí a sholáthar do dhuine eile ar chomaoin
In general, contracts do not have to be in writing in order to be enforceable
Go ginearálta, ní chaithfidh conarthaí a bheith i scríbhinn chun a bheith in-fheidhmithe
However, contracts for the sale of land and contracts governed by the Consumer Credit Act 1995 must be in writing in order to be enforceable
Mar sin féin, ní mór do chonarthaí chun talamh a dhíol agus na conarthaí rialaithe ag an Acht um Chreidmheas do Thomhaltóirí 1995 a bheith i scríbhinn chun a bheith in-fheidhmithe
Failure to pay is a breach of the contract
Is sárú ar an gconradh é mura n-íocann tú
Contracts may include penalty clauses for failure to meet the terms of the contract
Is féidir le conarthaí clásail phíonóis a chuimsiú mar gheall ar loiceadh théarmaí an chonartha a chomhlíonadh
So, for example, the contract may provide that you must pay an extra charge or you must pay interest if you fail to pay on time
Mar sin, mar shampla, d'fhéadfadh an conradh a fhoráil go gcaithfidh tú táille breise a íoc nó nach mór duit ús a íoc má theipeann ort íoc in am
In this context, a Court judgment states that you owe a debt
Sa chomhthéacs seo, deir breithiúnas cúirte go bhfuil fiach dlite agat
That judgment can then be enforced in various ways
Is féidir an breithiúnas a chur i bhfeidhm ansin ar bhealaí éagsúla
Your credit rating or credit score is based on whether your credit repayment record is good or poor
Tá do rátáil chreidmheasa nó scór creidmheasa bunaithe ar cibé acu an bhfuil do thaifead aisíocaíochta creidmheasa go maith nó go holc
It is used to help lenders to assess the ability of borrowers to repay any future debts
Baineann iasachtóirí úsáid aisti chun cumas iasachtaithe a gcuid iasachtaí sa todhchaí a aisíoc a mheas
Banks and other lenders generally send information about borrowers to a central database that is operated by a credit reference agency or credit register
Go ginearálta, seolann bainc agus iasachtóirí eile faisnéis faoi iasachtaithe chuig bunachar sonraí lárnach atá á oibriú ag gníomhaireacht teistiméireachta creidmheasa nó clár creidmheasa
This information includes what credit agreements you have made and your history of repaying them
Áirítear leis an bhfaisnéis seo na comhaontuithe creidmheasa a rinne tú agus do stair maidir le hiad a íoc
Your credit rating is based on this information
Tá do rátáil chreidmheasa bunaithe ar an eolas sin
Read more in our document on credit ratings
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis faoi rátálacha creidmheasa
The creditor is the person (or company) to whom you owe money
Is é an creidiúnaí an duine (nó comhlacht) a bhfuil airgead aige ort
This person is known as the judgment creditor if judgment is awarded against you in court
Tugtar creidiúnaí breithiúnais ar an duine seo má tá breithiúnas tugtha aige i do choinne sa chúirt
Debt forbearance and forgiveness
Staonadh agus maithiúnas féich

Debt forbearance is the term that is sometimes used by creditors when they agree to allow you to change the manner in which your debt will be repaid, for example, by postponing some payments or by restructuring the manner in which repayments are made

Is é staonadh féich an téarma a úsáideann creidiúnaithe uaireanta nuair a aontaíonn siad deis a thabhairt duit an modh ina mbeidh d’fhiach á aisíoc agat a athrú, mar shampla, trí roinnt íocaíochtaí a chur ar athló nó tríd an modh a ndéantar aisíocaíochtaí a athstruchtúrú
You continue to owe all the money and you will eventually have to repay it all
Leanann tú ar aghaidh leis an airgead go léir a dhlí agus beidh ort é ar fad a íoc ar ais sa deireadh
Debt forgiveness or cancellation occurs when your creditor decides not to pursue the debt
Tarlaíonn maithiúnas nó cealú féich nuair a chinneann do chreidiúnaí gan an fiach a leanúint
Permanent debt forgiveness is rare
Is annamh é maithiúnas féich buan
Some creditors may cease to pursue the debt because they recognise that you will never be able to repay it but that does not mean that the debt is forgiven or cancelled
D'fhéadfadh roinnt creidiúnaithe stopadh an fiach a leanúint de bharr go n-aithníonn siad nach mbeidh tú in ann é a aisíoc riamh ach ní chiallaíonn sé sin go bhfuil an fiach maite nó cealaithe
If your circumstances change, you may still be pursued for it
Má thagann athrú ar d’imthosca, is féidir leat a bheith feidhmithe fós dó
A debt management firm is one that charges for the provision of debt management services
Is éard is gnólacht um bainistiú fiachais ná ceann a ghearrann costas chun seirbhísí bainistithe fiachais a sholáthar
The Central Bank (Supervision and Enforcement) Act 2013 defines debt management services as:
Seo a leanas mar a shainmhínítear seirbhísí bainistithe fiachais in Acht an Bhainc Cheannais (Maoirseacht agus Forghníomhú) 2013:
• Giving advice about the discharge of debts (in whole or in part), including advice about budgeting in connection with the discharge of debts
• Comhairle a thabhairt maidir le urscaoileadh fiacha (go hiomlán nó i bpáirt), lena n-áirítear comhairle maidir le buiséadú i ndáil le urscaoileadh fiachais
• Negotiating with a person’s creditors for the discharge of the person’s debts (in whole or in part), or
• Idirbheartaíocht le creidiúnaithe duine maidir le hurscaoileadh fiachais an duine sin (go hiomlán nó i bpáirt), nó
• Any similar activity associated with the discharge of debts
• Aon ghníomhaíocht den chineál céanna a bhaineann le urscaoileadh fiachais, atá á rialú ag an mBanc Ceannais
There are a number of private commercial debt management firms, which are regulated by the Central Bank
Tá Riachtanais agus Caighdeáin Údaraithe do Gnólachtaí Bainistíochta Fiachais (pdf) foilsithe ag an mBanc
The Money Advice and Budgeting Service (MABS) is a non-commercial body providing debt management services and it does not charge fees
Is comhlacht neamhthráchtála í an tSeirbhís Bhuiséadta agus Chomhairle Airgid a chuireann seirbhísí bainistithe fiachais ar fáil agus ní ghearrann sí táillí
Debt Relief Notice (DRN)
Fógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais (DRN)
Under the Personal Insolvency Act 2012, the Debt Relief Notice is designed for people who have very low disposable income or assets
Faoin Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta tá an Fógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais ann chun freastal ar dhaoine a bhfuil ioncam nó sócmhainní indiúscartha an-ísle acu
It allows for the write-off of qualifying debt up to €20,000, subject to a 3-year supervision period
Ceadóidh sé díscríobh fiachais cháilithigh suas le €20,000, faoi réir tréimhse mhaoirseachta 3 bliana
Under the Personal Insolvency (Amendment) Act 2015, the limit has increased to €35,000 with effect from 29 September 2015
Déanann an tAcht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (Leasú) 2015 foráil do mhéadú ar an uasteorainn seo go dtí €35,000
Read more in our document on Debt Relief Notices
Níl éifeacht leis an méadú sin go fóill
Debt Settlement Arrangement (DSA)
Socruithe Réitigh Fiachais (DSA)
Under the Personal Insolvency Act 2012, the Debt Settlement Arrangement applies to the agreed settlement of unsecured debts, usually over a period of 5 years
Faoin Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2013, baineann an Socrú Réitigh Fiachais le socrú comhaontaithe fiach neamhurraithe thar thréimhse 5 bliana de ghnáth
(See Secured loan below for definition.) The limit of 5 years can increase to 6 years in some situations
(Féach iasacht urraithe thíos chun sainmhíniú a fháil.) Is féidir an teorainn 5 bliana a mhéadú go 6 bliana i gcásanna áirithe
When the DSA concludes successfully, the debts that it covers will be fully discharged and the debtor will be solvent again
Nuair a chuirtear an DSA i gcrích go sásúil, urscaoilfear na fiacha a chlúdaíonn sé agus beidh an féichiúnaí sócmhainneach an athuair
Read more in our document on Debt Settlement Arrangements
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis faoi Shocruithe Réitigh Fiachais
You are a debtor if you owe money to someone
Is féichiúnaí tú má tá airgead ag duine éigin ort
If a court judgment is awarded against you, you are now a judgment debtor
Má tá breithiúnas cúirte bronnta i do choinne, is tusa féichiúnaí an bhreithiúnais
Debts and criminal offences
Fiacha agus cionta coiriúla
Most debts arise because you have failed to meet the terms of a contract
Tagann an chuid is mó d’fhiacha toisc gur theip ort téarmaí an chonartha a chomhlíonadh
For example, you borrow money from the bank or credit union and you fail to pay it back, or you enter into an agreement to buy equipment by instalments and you fail to pay

Mar shampla, faigheann tú airgead ar iasacht ó bhanc nó ó chomhar creidmheasa agus teipeann ort é a aisíoc ar ais nó téann tú i gcomhaon chun trealamh a cheannach trí thráthchodanna agus teipeann ort é a íoc
It is a breach of contract to fail to pay such debts - it is not generally a criminal offence
Is sárú conartha é má theipeann ort fiacha den tsórt sin a íoc; ní cion coiriúil é i gcoitinne
However, it is a criminal offence to fail to pay certain debts
Is cion coiriúil é má theipeann ort fiacha áirithe a íoc
For example, it is an offence not to pay your taxes or your TV licence fee
Mar shampla, is cion é gan do chánacha, muirir dara baile nó táille cheadúnas teilifíse a íoc
You may be charged and convicted for failure to pay such debts
Is féidir leat a bheith muirearaithe agus ciontaithe as loiceadh fiacha den tsórt sin a íoc
Even if you are charged, convicted and fined, you still owe the debt and can be sued for it in the normal way
Fiú má tá tú muirearaithe, ciontaithe agus fíneáilte, tá an fiach dlite agat fós agus is féidir thú a agairt lena aghaidh ar an ngnáthbhealach
Excluded and excludable debts
Fiachas eisiata agus in-eisiata
The Personal Insolvency Act 2012 specifies certain types of debt that cannot be written off by a Debt Relief Notice, a Debt Settlement Arrangement or a Personal Insolvency Arrangement

Sonraítear san Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012 roinnt cineálacha fiachas nach féidir a dhíscríobh le Fógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais, Socrú Réitigh Fiachais ná Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
These are called excluded debts and are:
Tugtar fiachas eisiata orthu sin agus seo a leanas samplaí:
• Debts under family law orders, such as maintenance orders for spouses and children
• Fiachais faoi orduithe dlí teaghlaigh, ar nós orduithe cothabhála do chéilí agus leanaí
• Debts due under court awards for personal injury or death
• Fiachais atá le híoc faoi dhámhachtain chúirte mar gheall ar ghortú pearsanta nó bás
• Debts arising from a loan (or forbearance of a loan) obtained through fraud or similar wrongdoing
• Fiachais a eascraíonn ó iasacht (nó staonadh iasachta) a fuarthas mar gheall ar chalaois nó éagóir dá samhail sin
• Debts arising under court orders made under the Proceeds of Crime Acts or fines imposed by the courts for criminal offences
• Fiachais a eascraíonn faoi orduithe cúirte a rinneadh faoi na hAchtanna um Fháltais ó Choireacht nó fíneálacha a ghearrann na cúirteanna mar gheall ar chionta coiriúla
The types of debt that may be written off are called excludable debts and are:
Is iad seo a leanas na cineálacha fiachais atá in-eisiata agus ar féidir a dhíscríobh:
• Taxes, duties or levies owed to the State, such as income tax, the Local Property Tax, VAT, capital taxes
• Cáin, dleachtanna nó tobhaigh atá le híoc leis an Stát, ar nós cáin ioncaim, Cáin Mhaoine Áitiúil, CBL, cáin chaipitiúil
• Service charges owed to local authorities
• Muirir sheirbhíse atá le híoc le húdaráis áitiúla
• Money owed under the Nursing Homes Support Scheme (in respect of a loan advanced by the HSE to a nursing home resident to cover the amount due from the principal private residence)

• Airgead atá le híoc faoin Scéim Tacaíochta do Thithe Altranais (i dtaca le hiasacht a réamhíoc FSS le cónaitheoir i dteach altranais chun íoc as an méid atá dlite ón bpríomháit chónaithe phríobháideach)
• Money owed to the Department of Social Protection
• Airgead atá le híoc leis an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí
• Debts due to owners’ management companies in respect of annual service charges or contributions due for multi-unit developments (this is the only non-State debt in this category)

• Fiachas atá le híoc le cuideachtaí bainistíochta úinéirí maidir le muirir nó le ranníocaíochtaí bliantúla seirbhíse atá dlite le haghaidh forbairtí ilaonad (seo an t-aon fhiachas neamhStáit sa chatagóir seo)
Mortgage Arrears Resolution Process (MARP)
Próiseas Réitigh do Riaráistí Morgáiste (MARP)

Under the Central Bank's Code of Conduct on Mortgage Arrears (CCMA) (pdf) mortgage lenders must operate a Mortgage Arrears Resolution Process (MARP) when dealing with borrowers in mortgage arrears or in pre-arrears

De réir an Chód Iompraíochta ar Riaráistí Morgáiste (CCMA) de chuid an Bhainc Cheannais ní mór d’iasachtóirí Próiseas Réitigh do Riaráistí Morgáiste (MARP) a úsáid agus iad ag déileáil le hiasachtaithe i riaráiste nó réamh-riaráiste morgáiste
The 4 steps of the MARP are: communication; financial information; assessment; and resolution
Is iad seo a leanas 4 chéim MARP: cumarsáid, faisnéis airgeadais; measúnú agus réiteach
Read more in our document on the Mortgage Arrears Resolution Process
Léigh tuilleadh in ár gcáipéis ar an bPróiseas Réitigh do Riaráistí Morgáiste
The Personal Insolvency Act 2012 states that:
Sonraítear san Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012:
• “insolvent”, in relation to a debtor, shall be construed as meaning that the debtor is unable to pay his or her debts in full as they fall due
• ciallóidh “dócmhainneacht”, i ndáil le féichiúnaí, nach bhfuil an féichiúnaí ina ann a c(h)uid fiacha a íoc in iomlán de réir mar a bhíonn siad dlite
The Personal Insolvency Act 2012 introduced 3 debt resolution mechanisms for people who cannot afford to pay their personal debts
Thug an tAcht um Dhócmhainneach Phearsanta isteach 3 mheicníocht réitigh fiachais chun cabhrú le daoine nach bhfuil in ann a bhfiachas pearsanta a íoc
These arrangements offer different solutions to people in different situations
Cuireann na socruithe seo réitigh dhifriúla ar fáil do dhaoine i gcásanna éagsúla
Read more in our document on these personal insolvency options
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis faoi na roghanna dócmhainneachta pearsanta seo
Personal Insolvency Arrangement (PIA)
Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (PIA)

Under the Personal Insolvency Act 2012, the Personal Insolvency Arrangement applies to the agreed settlement and/or restructuring of secured debts up to a total of €3 million (as well as unsecured debts) over a period of 6 years

Faoin Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012, baineann an Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta le réiteach comhaontaithe agus/nó athstruchtúrú fiachais faoi urrús suas go dtí €3 milliún in iomlán (mar aon le fiachas gan urrús) thar thréimhse 6 bliana
The cap of €3 million can be increased by agreement with your secured creditors and the limit of 6 years can increase to 7 years in some situations
Is féidir an uasteorainn €3 milliún a mhéadú trí chomhaontú le do chreidiúnaithe faoi urrús agus is féidir an uasteorainn 6 bliana a mhéadú go dtí 7 mbliana i gcásanna áirithe
Read more in our document on Personal Insolvency Arrangements
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis faoi Shocruithe um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta
Personal Insolvency Practitioner (PIP)
Cleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (PIP)

A Personal Insolvency Practitioner (PIP) is a professional who is authorised by the Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) and will act on your behalf throughout a Debt Settlement Arrangement or a Personal Insolvency Arrangement

Is éard is Cleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (PIP) ná gairmí arna údarú ag Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (ISI) agus feidhmeoidh sé/sí ar do shon le linn Socrú Réitigh Fiachais nó Socrú Dócmhainneacht Phearsanta
A Prescribed Financial Statement (PFS) is a written statement of a debtor’s financial affairs
Is éard is Ráiteas Forordaithe Airgeadais (PFS) ná ráiteas scríofa faoi chúrsaí airgeadais féichiúnaí

Every applicant must complete a PFS with the help of an Approved Intermediary (for a Debt Relief Notice) or a Personal Insolvency Practitioner (for a Debt Settlement Arrangement or a Personal Insolvency Arrangement)

Ní mór do gach iarratasóir PFS a chomhlánú le cabhair ó Idirghabhálaí Faofa (d’Fhógra um Fhaoiseamh Fiachais) nó ó Chleachtóir um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (do Shocrú Réitigh Fiachais nó do Shocrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta)

The PFS is used to establish the applicant’s eligibility for a debt resolution mechanism; to form the basis for calculating a sustainable contribution to be paid to the applicant’s creditors over the period of a DSA or PIA and to identify the liabilities from which the applicant will be discharged at the end of an arrangement

Baintear úsáid as PFS chun incháilitheacht iarratasóra maidir le meicníocht réitigh fiachais a bhunú; mar bhonn le haghaidh ranníocaíochta inbhuanaithe atá le híoc le creidiúnaithe an iarratasóra a ríomh thar tréimhse DSA nó PIA agus chun na dliteanais as a urscaoilfear an t-iarratasóir ag deireadh an socruithe a aithint
The term priority debt can be used in a general sense but it can also have a specific legal meaning
Is féidir an téarma fiach tosaíochta a úsáid i mbrí ginearálta ach is féidir brí dlíthiúil ar leith a bheith aige freisin
If you owe money to a number of creditors, you have your own view of which of these debts take priority
Má tá airgead ag roinnt creidiúnaithe ort, tá do thuairim féin agat maidir le cé acu de na fiacha a ghlacann tosaíocht
Most people would regard the repayments on their home as taking priority over the repayment of other loans
Ceapfadh formhór na ndaoine go nglacfadh aisíocaíochtaí ar a mbaile tosaíocht ar aisíocaíocht iasachtaí eile
The legal meaning of priority debt may be different
Féadfaidh an bhrí dhlíthiúil 'fiacha tosaíochta' a bheith difriúil
For example, in receiverships, liquidations and bankruptcy, the law sets out the order in which the debts must be paid
Mar shampla, i nglacadóireachtaí, i leachtuithe agus i bhféimheacht, leagann an dlí síos an t-ord a gcaitear na fiacha a íoc

This is a certificate issued by a court to protect the debtor against legal proceedings by a creditor in respect of debts while a Personal Insolvency Arrangement (PIA) or a Debt Settlement Arrangement (DSA) is being put in place

Is éard is deimhniú cosanta ann ná deimhniú arna eisiúint ag cúirt chun an féichiúnaí a chosaint i gcoinne imeachtaí dlí ag creidiúnaí maidir le fiachais fad is atá Socrú um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta (PIA) nó Socrú Réitigh Fiachais (DSA) á gcur i bhfeidhm
The protective certificate gives you 70 days during which your creditors may not:
Tabharfaidh an deimhniú cosanta 70 lá duit, tráth nach féidir le do chreidiúnaithe an méid a leanas a dhéanamh:
• Start or continue legal proceedings in respect of the debt
• Tús a chur le himeachtaí dlí maidir leis an bhfiachas nó leanúint leis na himeachtaí siúd
• Take or continue any steps to enforce a judgment or contact you about the debt unless you agree to this
• Dul i mbun aon bhirt chun breithiúnas a fhorfheidhmiú nó leanúint leis na bearta siúd nó teagmháil a dhéanamh leat faoin bhfiachas mura gcomhaontaíonn tú leis seo
• Start or continue bankruptcy proceedings against you
• Tús a chur le himeachtaí féimheachta i do leith nó leanúint leis na himeachtaí siúd

Reasonable living expenses are the expenses that an insolvent debtor will necessarily incur in achieving a ‘reasonable standard of living’ while engaging in one of the arrangements introduced by the Personal Insolvency Act 2012

Is éard is costais réasúnta mhaireachtála ná costais riachtanacha a thabhóidh féichiúnaí d’fhonn ‘caighdeán réasúnta maireachtála’ a bhaint amach agus é nó í i mbun ceann de na socruithe a tugadh isteach leis an Acht um Dhócmhainneacht Phearsanta 2012
This minimum standard of living allows for expenses such as food, clothing, health, education, transport, childcare and insurance
Ceadaíonn an meánchaighdeán maireachtála sin costais cosúil le bia, éadaí sláinte, oideachas, iompar, cúram leanaí agus árachas
The ISI has prepared detailed guidelines on what constitutes reasonable living expenses
Tá treoirlínte sonraithe ullmhaithe ag an ISI ar cad is costais réasúnta mhaireachtála ann
These guidelines are regularly updated, as required under the Act
Déantar na treoirlínte sin a nuashonrú go rialta, mar a éilítear faoin Acht
There is also an online calculator
Tá áireamhán ar líne ar fáil chomh maith
This is a loan on which property or goods are available as security against non-payment
Is iasacht í ar a bhfuil maoin nó earraí ar fáil mar urrús in aghaidh neamhíoca
Mortgages are the most common secured loans
Is iad morgáistí na hiasachtaí urraithe is coitianta
Sometimes, business loans and other loans are also secured against property
Uaireanta, tá iasachtaí gnó agus iasachtaí eile daingnithe in aghaidh maoine freisin
In general, debts such as bank loans and credit card debt are unsecured
Go ginearálta, níl fiacha cosúil le hiasachtaí bainc agus fiach cárta creidmheasa daingnithe
However, if you decide to roll up such loans into your mortgage, they now become secured loans
Mar sin féin, má shocraíonn tú iasachtaí mar sin a rolladh suas i do mhorgáiste, bíonn siad mar iasachtaí urraithe anois
If the property or goods on which the security is based are subsequently sold, the secured loan must be paid off before the proceeds can be used for any other purposes
Má dhíoltar an mhaoin nó na hearraí ar a bhfuil an slándáil bunaithe ina dhiaidh sin, ní mór an iasacht a íoc sular féidir na fáltais a úsáid le haghaidh aon chríocha eile
This is a debt which arises because you have not paid for goods or services which are not covered by any special rules
Is fiach é seo a thagann chun solais de bharr nach bhfuil tú tar éis íoc as earraí nó seirbhísí nach bhfuil clúdaithe ag rialacha speisialta ar bith
For example, if you buy goods using a cheque and the cheque is not honoured, there is a simple contract debt to the seller
Mar shampla, má cheannaíonn tú earraí ag baint úsáide as seic agus ní onóraítear an seic, tá fiach conartha simplí dlite don díoltóir
If you use the services of a plumber and do not pay him, there is a simple contract debt to the plumber
Má bhaineann tú leas as na seirbhísí as pluiméir agus íocann tú é, tá fiach conartha simplí don phluiméir
The seller or the plumber can go to court to get judgment against you and then enforce that judgment
Is féidir leis an díoltóir nó an pluiméir dul chun na cúirte chun breithiúnas a fháil i do choinne agus an breithiúnas a chur i bhfeidhm ansin
A range of legislation provides that various fees and levies which have not been paid may be dealt with in court in the same way as simple contract debts
Soláthraíonn raon reachtaíochta gur féidir deileáil le táillí éagsúla agus tobhaigh nach bhfuil íoctha sa chúirt ar an mbealach céanna le fiacha conartha simplí
Sheriffs are self-employed people who enforce debt judgments in counties Cork and Dublin
Is daoine féinfhostaithe iad Sirriamaí a fhorfheidhmíonn breithiúnais fiachais i gcontae Chorcaí agus i gcontae Bhaile Átha Cliath
County Registrars enforce debt judgments in all other places
Forfheidhmíonn Cláraitheoirí Contae breithiúnais fiachais i ngach áit eile
Sheriffs are paid for their enforcement work on a commission basis
Íoctar sirriamaí as a gcuid obair fhorfheidhmithe ar bhonn coimisiúin
As well as County Sheriffs in Cork and Dublin, Revenue Sheriffs enforce debts owed to the Revenue Commissioners
Chomh maith le Sirriamaí Contae i gCorcaigh agus i mBaile Átha Cliath tá Sirriamí Ioncaim a chuireann fiacha atá dlite do na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim i bhfeidhm
They have the power to collect tax debts
Tá an chumhacht acu fiacha cánach a bhailiú
They can do this on the basis of a certificate of liability issued by the Collector General and do not need a court order
Is féidir leo é seo a dhéanamh trí theastas fiachais eisithe ag an Ard-Bhailitheoir agus ní gá ordú cúirte a bheith acu
Revenue debts can also be collected in the normal way if there is a court order
Is féidir fiacha ioncaim a bhailiú freisin ar an ngnáthbhealach má tá ordú cúirte ann

A Standard Financial Statement (SFS) is a written statement of financial affairs on an industry standard format (pdf), which a borrower in mortgage difficulty must complete as part of the Mortgage Arrears Resolution Process (MARP)

Is éard is Ráiteas Airgeadais Caighdeánach (SFS) ná ráiteas scríofa maidir le cúrsaí airgeadais ar fhormáid tionscalchaighdeánach, nach mór d’iasachtaí le deacrachtaí morgáiste a chomhlánú mar chuid de Phróiseas Réitigh do Riaráistí Morgáiste (MARP)
The lender must give the borrower an SFS form and must ensure that the borrower understands the MARP process
Ní mór don iasachtóir foirm SFS a thabhairt don iasachtaí agus a chinntiú go dtuigeann an t-iasachtaí an próiseas MARP
It must offer help with completing the SFS and mention sources of independent advice, such as MABS
Ní mór dó cabhair a thairiscint chun an SFS a chomhlánú agus foinsí comhairle neamhspleácha, cosúil le MABS a lua
It then uses the financial information on the form to assess the borrower’s financial position and identify the best course of action
Baineann sé úsáid ansin as an t-eolas airgeadais ar an bhfoirm chun seasamh airgeadais an iasachtaí a mheas agus an cúrsa is fearr gníomhaíochta a aithint
The Central Bank has a consumer guide (pdf) to completing an SFS
Tá treoir do thomhaltóirí ag an mBanc Ceannais faoi conas SFS a chomhlánú
MABS has also published a detailed guide to the SFS (pdf)
Tá treoir mhionsonraithe maidir le SFS foilsithe ag MABS chomh maith
Time limits/Statute of Limitations
Teorainneacha ama/Reacht na dTréimhsí
There are time limits (limitation periods) for taking most types of court action
Tá teorainneacha ama (tréimhsí teorannaithe) chun tabhairt faoi bheagnach gach cineál gníomh cúirte
These time limits are set either in the Statute of Limitations 1957, as amended, or in specific legislation dealing with the court issue involved
Tá na teorainneacha ama seo leagtha amach i Reacht na dTréimhsí 1957, arna leasú, nó i reachtaíocht shonrach ag déileáil leis an gceist cúirte i gceist

The law in relation to time limits is complex but, in general, the time limit for taking actions for breach of contract (for example, failure to pay for goods or services provided), for debt judgments and for non-payment of charges such as rent is 6 years

Tá an dlí maidir le teorainneacha ama casta ach, go ginearálta, is í sé bliana an teorainn ama chun gníomhartha a ghlacadh maidir le sárú conartha (mar shampla, loiceadh íoc as earraí nó seirbhísí a sholáthar), le haghaidh breithiúnas fiacha agus muirir i leith neamhíoc ar nós cíosa
This means that if your creditor does not start the court action within 6 years of the debt being due, the action is statute-barred
Ciallaíonn sé seo mura gcuireann do chreidiúnaí tús le caingne dlí laistigh de 6 bliana maidir leis an bhfiach atá dlite, tá an gníomh faoi urchosc reachta
Effectively, that means that you cannot be forced to pay the debt
Go héifeachtach, ciallaíonn sé sin nach féidir iallach a chur ort an fiach a íoc
If your creditor gets a judgment, then, in general, they have 12 years in which to enforce that judgment
Sa chás go bhfaigheann do chreidiúnaí breithiúnas, go ginearálta, tá 12 bliain acu an breithiúnas sin a fhorfheidhmiú
The general rules do not apply to taxes
Ní bhaineann na rialacha ginearálta le cánacha
There is a 4-year time limit on the Revenue Commissioners seeking tax from you and there is a 4-year time limit on you seeking repayment of taxes that you were not due to pay
Tá teorainn ama 4 bliana ar na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim ag lorg cána uait agus tá teorainn 4 bliana ort aisíoc cánacha a lorg nach raibh tú dlite a íoc
However, if there is any fraud or neglect, there is no time limit
Mar sin féin, má tá calaois nó faillí ar bith ann, níl teorainn ama ar bith ann
